summary: An email from an FBI SSA in Squad C-20 (VCAC/Human Trafficking) sent on July 2, 2019, informing team members that Jeffrey Epstein has been indicted in the Southern District of New York and a warrant for his arrest has been issued. The email coordinates immediate operational planning for Epstein's arrest upon his return to the U.S., execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, interviews with co-conspirators, and deployment of agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview individuals.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment and arrest warrant; believed to be in France at the time of the email.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York and a warrant for his arrest was sworn out.

events.title: Operational Planning for Arrest
events.description: FBI Squad C-20 is placed on standby to plan for Epstein's arrest upon his return to the U.S., execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, and interviews with co-conspirators.

events.title: Florida Subpoena and Interview Deployment
events.description: The FBI plans to deploy two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and attempt to interview 1-3 individuals.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on July 2, 2019, and an arrest warrant was issued.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France, and the FBI planned to arrest him upon his return to the U.S.
The FBI's operational plan included executing a search warrant at Epstein's residence in New York City and interviewing co-conspirators.
Two FBI agents were to be deployed to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview 1-3 individuals.
The email indicates the investigation and arrest planning involved the entire FBI Squad C-20 (VCAC/Human Trafficking), with assistance from other units.
